article_title: The Case of the Headless Lawsuit
article_text:
If you sue a company, and the company offers to settle by giving you exactly what you asked for, can you keep suing anyway? On Wednesday the Supreme Court will hear a case in which the head plaintiff in a class-action lawsuit is offered everything he wants but litigates regardless.

In Campbell-Ewald Co. v. Gomez, the defendant is a contractor that created digital marketing strategies to recruit for the U.S. Navy. Campbell-Ewald came up with a text message that said “Destined for something big? Do it in the Navy. Get a...

article_metadata.article.origheadline: The Case of the Headless Lawsuit

article_summary:
On Wednesday the Supreme Court will hear a case in which the head plaintiff in a class-action lawsuit is offered everything he wants but litigates regardless.
If you sue a company, and the company offers to settle by giving you exactly what you asked for, can you keep suing anyway?
In Campbell-Ewald Co. v. Gomez, the defendant is a contractor that created digital marketing strategies to recruit for the U.S. Navy.
Campbell-Ewald came up with a text message that said “Destined for something big?
Do it in the Navy.
